question: Where do the dairy cows Guernsey and Jersey originate from?
explanation:
The best dairy cows that form the foundation of modern dairy farming in most parts of the world are native to Western Europe.
The most popular dairy cow, the Holstein-Friesian originated in the coastal lowlands of the Netherlands and
Germany.
Other popular dairy cows include Guernsey and Jersey from the Channel Islands, Ayrshires from Scotland and Brown Swiss from Switzerland.
